transcript:
One hand moved as if to clutch the window sill, but refrained from touching it. Pierre again covered his eyes and thought he would never open them again. Sud- denly he was aware of a stir all around. He looked up: D61okhov was standing on the win- dow sill, with a pale but radiant face. "It's empty!" 
He threw the bottle to the Englishman, who caught it neatly. D61okhov jumped down. He smelt strongly of rum. 
"Well done! . . . Fine fellow! . . . There's a bet for you! . . . Devil take you!" c
